channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In Arizona, Immigration Policies of the Moment Mimic the Policies of the Past
item.description: Republicans are hoping a proposal revisiting the tough immigration policies of a decade ago will turn out voters.

item.title: India Election Results: Live Updates
item.description: See results and maps from India’s 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

item.title: The world's wealthy need to pay up to address the climate crisis, says the top expert behind the Paris Agreement
item.description: Decarbonizing isn't cheap or easy, but the wealthy are responsible for the bulk of the emissions—can we actually hold them accountable?

item.title: Devastation in Ukraine
item.description: Measuring every town, street and building blown apart since the Russian invasion.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Airstrikes Kill Iranian General in Syria
item.description: The officer in the Revolutionary Guards was the first Iranian to be killed by Israel since a strike on an embassy compound in April.

item.title: Forget employees. Artificial Intelligence may upend entrepreneurship as we know it
item.description: For every decent idea, a cottage industry of as-good-or-better imitators will emerge almost immediately.

item.title: Biden’s Asylum Order, and India’s Surprisingly Close Election
item.description: Plus, the scale of destruction in Ukraine.

item.title: Live Updates: India’s Election Results Suggest a Setback for Modi
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s governing alliance may be headed toward a narrower majority in Parliament, based on early results.

item.title: Traders who scooped up Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway shares at a massive $620,000 discount during ‘glitch’ will have their deals canceled by the NYSE
item.description: In an update posted at 9 p.m. last night NYSE said it would "bust" all the "erroneous" trades of Berkshire Hathaway stock at or below $603,718.30 a share.

item.title: Israel Says 4 More Hostages Are Dead, Killed Months Ago in Gaza
item.description: The disclosure by the military was likely to add pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government to move forward with a cease-fire deal.

item.title: Early Election Results Suggest Turnaround for Indian National Congress
item.description: India’s beleaguered main opposition party was on track to surpass expectations and nearly double its share of parliamentary seats from 2019.

item.title: Hedge funds paying for 'literally insane' short on U.K. stocks
item.description: Hedge funds have been caught off guard by sudden valuation jumps as companies eye cheap U.K. stocks.

item.title: Ibram X. Kendi Faces a Reckoning of His Own
item.description: In 2020, the author of “How to Be an Antiracist” galvanized Americans with his ideas. The past four years have tested them — and him.

item.title: What Ukraine Has Lost During Russia’s Invasion
item.description: We measured every town, street and building blown apart in Ukraine to show the first comprehensive picture of where people can’t return home.

item.title: De Beers ditches lab-grown diamonds and shifts focus to natural stones — as it looks beyond mining giant Anglo
item.description: Ending a six-year program that broke one of its oldest taboos.
